data.question: What is the name of the Zn(II) analogue in the series of gyroidal MOFs?
Which metal ions were used to synthesize the series of gyroidal MOFs?
What unique property does STU-1 exhibit according to the text?
data.answer: Exceptional thermal and chemical stabilities, permanent porosity, and CO2 capture ability

data.question: Is the coordination geometry of Zn(II) in STU-1 tetrahedral?
Can STU-1 maintain its crystallinity at high temperatures up to 650 °C under vacuum conditions?
Does the synthesis of STU-2 require a mixture of DMF and ethanol as solvents?
What is the space group of STU-1 to STU-4?
What method is used for the synthesis of STU-1?
Is the BET surface area of STU-1 considered high compared to other ZIFs?
What is the CO2 capture ability of STU-1 at 273 K?
Does the gyroidal structure of STU-1 contribute to its gas adsorption behavior?
data.answer: It is unclear but deserves further investigation

data.question: Are the guest molecules in STU-1 to STU-4 highly disordered?
What is the role of the hydrazone bridge in the synthesis of gyroidal MOFs?
data.answer: It allows the usage of octahedral metal ions

data.question: Can STU-1 be synthesized using different solvents like DMF, DEF, or DMF/ethanol?
What is the crystallographic symmetry of the large-scale polycrystalline sample of STU-1?
Is the coordination geometry of Zn(II) in STU-1 common in ZIFs?
What is the main approach to manipulate the conformation of the linkage in ZIFs?
data.answer: By employing functionalized Im links or using structure-directing agents

data.question: Does STU-1 exhibit a type I adsorption isotherm for N2 at 77 K?
What is the unit cell volume of STU-1?
Is the thermal stability of STU-1 lower than that of inorganic BSV zeolites?
